Reviews.Title: “surpassed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: rlevittesq
Reviews.Content: went to paris after 30 years for my 65th birthday on an air france package...chose jardin le brea as the least amercanized hotel on the package deal as a guess...but we were sooo pleased with the location....close to 2 metro stops and many restaurants and yet..on a quiet street close to the gardens and everything in the 6th!. the rooms were more than adequate..and SOOO clean with any amenity needed...the breakfast was plentiful...and served efficiently but with warmth...but the deal closer was the staff...stephanie and gaell....went out of their way to make us feel at home...answered all our questions looked out for our safety...and even put a candle in my croissant and sang me happy birthday! when we come back to paris...i would definitely come back my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel; Service & Location!”
Reviews.Author: jlamp
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris visiting with 4 other couples and we selected Hotel Jardin on a recommendation from a friend in the US and I have to share it with all! It is fabulous in every way from the location and ease of jumping on/off the metro at Vavin to the nice rooms (we had 5 different rooms and all were great!) to the tour advice giving to us by Candy. Candy was amazing and gave us one of our favorite afternoons in all of Paris. She suggested we spend the afternoon at Basilica of the Sacre Coeur as there was a festival going on; it was awesome and we never would have known about it without her knowledge. The hotel is lovely and we will all stay here on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: andrea_vdv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay here! The staff was very friendly, the cleaning service was great, breakfast was satisfying, and the rooms were so cute! We loved the location in the heart of the Latin Quarter. The Luxembourg gardens were only a block or two away, and the Seine not too much farther. There is a great wine boutique across the street called La Quin Cave - the staff is very friendly and helpful! The train station is only a short walk away, and the subway is very close by. I definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Montparnasse refuge”
Reviews.Author: Leslie372
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my son and me. Quiet location, but right near the Vavin metro station, and from there, one can get anywhere in Paris. Plus there's a taxi stand at the end of the street, and the Montparnasse train station is only a 15-minute walk. The hotel has been refurbished recently. Rooms are exquisitely clean. Staff is very helpful and English-speaking. Lots of restaurants, cafes, sandwich shops and brasseries nearby. Rooms are small but adequate. Breakfast lacked only strong coffee and healthy cereal. Can't speak to value, as we booked as part of a package. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: JTFBrussels
Reviews.Content: The location is good as it is right on a subway line and easy connection from the Gare Du Nord. The rooms are indeed tiny, even by Euro standards, but the bathroom was good sized. The lobby and other common areas are nicely decorated and well maintained, unlike similar level of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Brent M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon this past September and it was perfect. The location was amazing, you are within walking distance of the majority of attractions within the city, only a block away from the metro which takes you to the sites that are further away. And only a 15 minute walk to the train station which takes you to the palace of Versailles. The location is definitely the greatest feature about this hotel. Immediately after we arrived, my wife and I walked down the street and within minutes we found ourselves the the Luxembourg Garden, which is amazing to walk around, and is a great way of locating our hotel when walking back from other sites. Another great feature about the hotel was the staff, they were very nice, helpful, and even humored my attempts at french based on my grade 9 knowledge. They constantly offered to help if we were in the lobby looking at maps trying to figure out where we were going, and they all had a very upbeat and friendly attitude. As for cleanliness, the room was always clean when we came back from a day of walking around the city, and when it was hot the maid would put on the air conditioner for us so that we could cool down when we got back. Overall this hotel was perfect for what we needed on our honeymoon, and we will definitely look in to staying here again when we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: jchristoph
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed. The room was very small, by Paris scale. E.g. there was only 15 cm on one side of the double bed. Air in the room the was sticky, despite the temperature of 18 degrees Celsius outside. A/C was operational but did not help too much. The garden which is referred to in the name of the hotel actually is a small (approx 2 m by 8 m) wooden deck with some plastic trees. Cleanliness in the main room appeared very good, but was not impressive in the bathroom (at more hidden places) What I also found unusual for a hotel for that class: they do not store your luggage but forward you to a self-service luggage room in the basement. Avoid breakfast: It is pricey and served in the basement. Location is good: You will find restaurants, a good bistro (at the corner Bd. Raspail), a supermarket, etc. near the hotel. Don't miss Tour Montparnasse which in my view is more convenient for taking a panorama view than the Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: CHawking
Reviews.Content: Tiny room, but good bathroom, nice view onto the street (quiet enough) but the best thing about this clean, safe place is it's location. Direct on line 4 from Gare du Nord (Eurostar), just up the road from Jardin du Luxembourg (which is beautiful, a great spot for people watching). Breakfast wasn't included - we easily found pavement cafes in both directions offering good value. If you do have breakfast in, be aware it's served in the basement (no windows) so functional not romantic. Staff and service perfectly adequate. Good vfm. Note no swimming pool to my knowledge despite it being listed on TA amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SharCaff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three years ago and returned because we enjoyed this hotel so much. Unfortunately it was not the same. This time we had a room on the third floor and could barely fit the two of us in the space. The decor itself seemed tired and run down. Our wake up call was overlooked (no clock in the room) and the morning of our check out my husband had to remove a large laundry hamper that was left in the elevator to get our suitcases down. Sadly, we can not recommend The Hotel Jardin le Brea.

Reviews.Title: “Far to small for two people”
Reviews.Author: HJay75
Reviews.Content: When you stay in France you expect the rooms to be small, the lifts to be tiny and the staff to be stand offish. Not all of these turned out to be true. I piled my partner into the lift with most of the baggage and set of up the stairs with the rest, I was not going to fit! We arrived in the room, the decor was very nice. Getting through the door was a bit of a trial, you had to get in shut the door and then move past the door with a suitcase and then repeat the whole process again with the other suitcases. We eventually managed to get us and our suitcases into the room; we sat on the bed surveying the scene. We were trying to work out where we were going to put things so we could get in and out of the door. We eventually managed this by pilling all three of our suitcases on top of each other in one corner. We still had the problem of moving around the room though, we eventually decided on the system of only one of us was allow to move at a time with the other sitting on the bed till the other had finished moving. There was a bedside table on my partners side but my side of the bed was only 20cm from the curtains, so not much room for getting in and out of bed, good job I’m on the skinny side and certainly no room for a bedside table so nowhere to put my water or glasses, which made getting out of bed all the more precarious. The bed incidentally was comfy and quite firm but I like it like that. The room had no drinks making facilities but I was expecting that. The air-con and safe were easy to operate, there was a TV but we didn’t turn it on. There was no ironing board and no room for one anyway. The bathroom did have a shower over the bath which was a plus but the head could have done with the lime scale removing so it didn’t shoot water in your eyes. It had one of those big soap/shampoo dispensers but I didn’t use it. The hairdryer was one of those ones that looks like a Hoover, which just tend to dry your hair rather than style, fine for blokes with long hair? Maybe? The bathroom also lacked curtains, it did have frosted glass but I found the lack of curtains disturbing especially when it was dark outside. We soon worked out that the soundproofing between the rooms was none existent, we could hear conversation in other rooms, and at one point could hear people weeing! Breakfast, if you want a croissant and why wouldn’t you your in France then it’s ok but rather pricey, the rest of breakfast was all prepacked in cellophane wrappers, or on the plastic side (Ham) or rubbery side (scrambled egg – no condiments) would defiantly recommend you went out for breakfast. Which brings us onto location, which is fantastic, ideally suited for cafes and restaurants and a Metro just over the road. Quiet at night as well, outside the hotel that is. The staff at this hotel are extremely friendly and helpful, the saving grace for this hotel. On the day of leaving, we had to get up early to catch a train, too early for breakfast, we went to get coffee from machine in the lobby but were told we were not allowed to have a drink before 7 as there were guest rooms on the ground floor and the machine made to much noise, we did eventually did get a coffee at 6:45. The hotel was renovated in 2008, it has been done very nicely but they seem to have crammed too many rooms into the hotel, which is a shame as the location is perfect. Would we stay there again, no, purely due to room size / sound proofing as it is a clean hotel, in a fantastic location with very friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Petite hotel with big heart”
Reviews.Author: Marnie09
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas at this hotel, using the cozy lounge for exchanging a few presents. Rooms are Paris petite but very clean with nice bathroom. Staff was very friendly and helpful. My son left some rings in the bathroom when we checked out and the staff sent them to him at no charge. The hotel is located nicely with métro close by, several nice restaurants, and in walking distance of Jardins du Luxenbourg. The breakfast was adequate, nothing special, but the whole "package" was just perfect for us. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Iris95
Reviews.Content: My husband and I especially enjoyed the location of this hotel near the Luxemborg Gardens. It's in a neighborhood away from the touristy fray. It is very convenient to several metro stops. Our tiny room had a comfortable queen bed but was really suitable for one person not two, but nevertheless it worked. They sent up an extra luggage rack which helped keep us organized. One of the best things this hotel has going for it, is the very helpful knowledgeable staff. Michel, who worked the night desk was particularly helpful in recommending restaurants and giving us directions on the metro. Another plus was the free internet in the lobby. Adequate breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little gem!”
Reviews.Author: scotlandlittleclan
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at the Jardin Le Brea. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and the location was ideal for us. The rooms may have been small but the comfort level was high. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A typical little Parisian hotel - just a little better in many ways”
Reviews.Author: germanwithoutsandals
Reviews.Content: If you have been to other Paris "three star" hotels, you'll know the lot - narrow starcases, ridiculously small elevators, tiny rooms that only just allow for walking around the bed towards the bathroom without touching the walls. Don't expect that to be different at Jardin le Bréa. But after the first night you'll have found out that the rooms are not only nicely appointed, but also meticulously cleaned, that the mattresses are quite new and allow for getting up at night without shaking your partner out of their sleep, and that the street, while full of restaurants and shops, is an unusually quiet one right in the middle of an area that offers every distraction and amenity that you have come to find at Paris in the first place. If you like a walk or jog in the park in the mornings it's two minutes' walk from Jardin du Luxembourg, and a metro station is just round the corner. The staff are friendly and efficient. It's a little bit more expensive than other hotels of its category, but you feel it's well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: ehrlichdieb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights and had a room street facing the street on the 2nd floor (3rd by US calculations). The rooms have been nicely updated and the the window to facing the street is insulated so you could block out the sounds from the narrow street below if you wished. The breakfast was very good and sustained us well into the day. We also sneaked out some cheese packets and bread for a light lunch. The location is great and we often came back in the afternoon to rest up from our walks around the city. I would stay there again on any subsequent trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, a perfect example of a small well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davesoa
Reviews.Content: I have nothing new to add to the other reviews. We stayed as a family, two adults and two older teenagers in two twin bedded rooms. The refurbishment is finished and the whole place feels clean and fresh - the staff are excellent, friendly and well informed. Travelling around is easy with the Metro a few minutes away. The area is full of restaurents, cafes and shops. You can walk to the Seine in approx 20 minutes. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hotel Jardin le BRILLIANT!”
Reviews.Author: FabFortyFive
Reviews.Content: You have probably guessed that we enjoyed our 3 nights at this charming Parisian hotel! Pretty hotel in a quiet street that ticked all our Parisian boxes and surpassed our expectations. Reception staff were unfailingly courteous, honest and helpful - we left an item in the safe after we had checked out, which was promptly returned to us when we went to collect our cases that staff had allowed us to leave in the hotel so we could enjoy our last few hours of this beautiful city. Footsore? Yes! Exhausted? Yes! Broke? without doubt! Happy? Definately!! Metro so close and very simple to navigate, the beautiful and atmospheric Luxembourg Gardens just at the end of the street, on the way you pass a bakery with rather nice tarte au citron.... oh and just for the record, there were no signs of building work going on.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel, very convenient to metro line 4”
Reviews.Author: parislover279
Reviews.Content: Husband & I just spent a week March 2011in this sweet hotel on a quiet street. Location is further from the Seine than I'm used to, but the Metro Line 4 is a 3 minute walk away and makes all of Paris easily accessible. Room is just fine for downtown Paris -- very clean. Some might say small, but it's standard for in-town in this price range, and we don't go to Paris to lounge around in a luxury suite - we go to enjoy the sights, smells & tastes outside our sleeping space. As to other reviews whining about the renovations in progress: we all need to update our homes periodically -- get over it. The workmen were very sensitive to our comings and goings, and were doing a great job. Importantly: the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. A lovely receptionist who spoke better English than I allowed me to struggle through my enthusiastic but broken French and even complimented me! This small hotel is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “proceed with caution”
Reviews.Author: epshedd
Reviews.Content: Such a potentially charming location in St Germaine De Pres area, but so very disappointing that we couldn't complete our stay. It would have helped tremendously if we had known that the hotel was under construction and that the phones and water were working intermittently. The front desk staff person was so helpful, warm and kind - honestly, she alone was the reason that we almost stayed, but in the end we opted to change hotels to assure the basic needs of phone, water and electricity were met. Smelling the worker's cigarette smoke and hearing the drills, sanders and other electric equipment during the brief time we were in the hotel was less than appealing. Proceed with caution. The work they are doing will definitely enhance the hotel once it is completed.

Reviews.Title: “It ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: BillyGrierson
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in Hotel Jardin le Brea. Right in the middle of the beautiful Montparnasse area. Hotel staff were just wonderful. Hotel was small and full of character. Can't go wrong with this one !

Reviews.Title: “Building Site in the Hotel lobby - very noisy !!”
Reviews.Author: Westbarn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at Le Brea celebrating our 40th Anniversary and Valentine's. The place is undergoing renovations and the ground floor is a building site during daylight hours. We were "upgraded" on our arrival to s superior double which happened to be within 5 metres of the epicentre of the workers' activities - tressles, drilling, hammering etc. I feel the place might live up to other reports in normal circumstances but it could hardly be recommemded at present. If you are travelling to le Brea within the next few weeks you might be advised to check first if work is still in progress.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: malvernian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights as a post-Christmas break. I chose the hotel because of its prime location, and because of the many good reviews posted on this site by other TripAdvisor members. Yes, the rooms were small, but they were also big enough for our needs, and spotlessly clean. My only gripe would be that the bath was rather small - even standing up in it to shower proved difficult for me (but then I am a tall man). The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and spoke English very well indeed. The breakfast in the morning was pretty good too - scrambled eggs, breads, croissants, cold ham, cheese, cereals, coffee, tea, juice, milk, fruit. Regarding the hotel's location - it was ideal. Situated in a small but lively street just off the Boulevard de Montparnasse, there was a plethora of cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance. If you are on a tight budget, you might find the prices in many of the local eating establishments a little prohibitive, so I would suggest you make your way to the Latin Quarter (metro line 4:St-Michel, 6 stops up from the local station), where you will find a large number of much cheaper restaurants. Remember that, for the most part, you get what you pay for. We found that the 3 dinners we had in the Latin Quarter were good value for money (45 euros for 3 courses, including wine and coffee). The 3 dinners we had in Montparnasse cost more, but were of a correspondingly better standard. Incidentally, the Vavin metro station is just a few yards from the hotel, making access to the metro system very easy indeed. Try to avoid travelling in the rush hour if you can - the trains get very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Charming even after two stays”
Reviews.Author: MeganMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2010 as well as 5 years ago. The hotel is located on a lovely street with a few restaurants, clothing shops, and specialty shops, and just around the corner from blvd Montparnasse with its famous restaurants and easy commuting. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The service is very friendly and helpful. I love the area and plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Stay”
Reviews.Author: glamisNewEngland
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is gorgeous. The room was beautiful and all the staff were friendly and helpful. A great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, charming first class hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: janetraveller
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a smaller, charming place to stay near Luxembourg Gardens this is it. Our room was on the third floor - either by a spiral staircase or small lift. Beautifully decorated, comfy beds (two twins pushed together) large bathroom with tub/shower combo. I don't know if the other rooms have as generous of a bathroom as we did - but it was great. We also had one good sized closet. We unpacked as much as we needed to put in the closet, lined up our shoes under the side table and left the rest in the bags. It was cozy but we were very comfortable. The windows in the bedroom and the bathroom open and there is also a/c. Our room faced the street and we could hear the goings on of the local restaurants and shops but it was not bothersome. Everything was very quiet by 11pm. We really enjoyed seeing and hearing the street come alive in the morning as the shops opened up. There are lovely restaurants every which way you turn in Paris but if you want to start your day in the hotel they offer a delightful light breakfast which includes scrambled eggs, lots of breads, croissants, cereal, milk, juice and coffee. The breakfast area is downstairs and quite charming as you will see in the photo. We found each staff member at the desk very friendly and quite helpful. There is a computer in the lobby. Luxembourg Gardens is a short walk away and the hotel is really ideally located for anyone visiting Paris. We can't wait to return and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: catalin_m
Reviews.Content: very good experience at Jardin Le Brea! breakfast was excellent, location is good, staff is very competent. the rooms are on the small size, we travelled with a 3-yr old and had a triple room which was good size but we also saw a double room which was very small. so if you travel with kids you better book the triple room.

Reviews.Title: “stay at jardin le brea hotel-you won't regret it-shannon pub is just across!!!”
Reviews.Author: ballsydes
Reviews.Content: This is a surprisingly very , very nice , safe and comfortable hotel. The front desk personnel, a guy and 2 ladies are on rotating shifts, they are all very warm and accomodating, and really helpful. A welcoming smile -that's what they give to all the guests that stay in this hotel. The guy that takes care of our breakfast in the breakfast room is also very, very nice, always visible when we need something. The breakfast is a buffet-style - scrambled eggs, fresh bread, flaky and freshly-baked croissants, muffins, scones, other types of bread, orange juice, coffee, tea assortment packets, butter, different kinds og jellies, ham, hot chocolate french packets, nutella spread packets, etc... let me tell you about our room- my daughter and i loved it so much! 2 twin beds with nice soft pillows , the room design is really my type of room in mind even before we entered the bedroom. the bathroom is quite big and a nice all-white color with a huge rectangular mirror, i love how they put a very stylish heater in this bathroom. aha! the other nice thing - a plus really, is that in this bathroom there is also a huge window ,but styled like a french balcony, oh my it is really very nice. in the bedroom, there is also a very huge window with a lace curtain. just looking out our window hotel is very pleasing- there's a bank, a pub called shannon pub, a butcher shop (la boucherie), a book shop, a few blocks down there is a pastry shop, pizza restaurant, crepes stands, oh, so many!). plain crepe with sugar and a little butter is about 1.50 euros. if you order a crepe in a restaurant it is about 7 euros. just get a crepe from the stands, it tastes the same. the lobby of. the hotel is also very elegant, with nice sofas, a fireplace, newspapers, tourist guide booklets. adjacent to the front desk there is another living room area which is also huge and provide a comfy ambiance. then to the corner there is a little flower garden ( we forgot to visit this garden!). there is also a stylish computer on the corner of the living room. i had to use the computer for like 30 minutes, and the guy at the front desk let me use it without a fee. very nice of him! before i forget, 2 days before our flight to new york, the guy at the desk was able to book a taxi for us to go to the charles de gaulle airport. the taxi driver was prompt. he is very nice and friendly and he comes inside the lobby to get us and assisted us in our luggage. his taxi is also elegant and a spacious one. on the way to the airport we were able to see other famous parisian sites like the moulin rouge, galleries lafayette, etc... too many to mention. the taxi driver was very helpful and very pleasant. on the way to the airport he picked like 6 more passengers from different hotels (this hotels are also nice looking!), coz these passengers are also going to the charlesde gaulle airport like us. the other passengers were also smiling and just friendly. i just love paris so much and the people. another plus, is that hotel le brea is surrounded by lots of restaurants like le dome, la rotonde cafe, etc. it is also very near the vavin metro train station. we just walked a few steps from our hotel to go to this metro station. then after vavin we got off at the gare station. we also walked from this hotel going to the world -famous luxembourg gardens. also from this hotel once you get out the main hotel door, just turn left, walk straight on the road and it will lead you to the river seine. the louvre is just beside the seine river! (tip: the entrance to the louvre museum itself is the triangle glass dome. even if you see a huge crowd waiting to enter the louvre, don't be intimidated,. everyone gets in fast). hotel jardin le brea is really an ideal hotel to stay in paris, france. near le dome cafe, there is a wide street which is really breath-taking- venture here and you can see lots of stores, restaurants, cafes, crepe stands. we walked here in the evening and its really nice. the capuccino at la rotonde is to die for, as well as the pasta , breads, chocolate crepe and the salmon that i had. from this hotel it is easy to go to the trocadero metro station (where the eiffel tower is), but as i mentioned before you have to go first to the vavin metro station. i'm also happy to mention here that we also went to the champs ellysees- and guess what, we went to see the world-famous out -of-this-world, LIDO show, please, please, even if this show is very expensive, you have to watch this show. i paid 140 euros or 150 euros each person to watch this show-this is the price that includes dinner. before the show and the dinner, beware they will take your picture and later they will sell this for $20.00 each. i was so excited for the show to start and i bought 2 pictures-one for my picture and 1 picture of my daughter. on the show brochure they have included the menu for this dinner. they serve dinner first, then the show. i'm tired of typing now, so have a happy and safe trip to those who plan on traveling to paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “cozy little hotel in lovely, quiet corner of the 6th”
Reviews.Author: martinamis
Reviews.Content: clean, quiet, friendly, great location, got a room facing into the courtyard (no view but very peaceful...room is tres european (tiny) but cozy and fine for two....courteous front desk personnel, great restaurants nearby, good firm mattress...what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Kathy47714
Reviews.Content: I was stranded in Paris when a friend of a friend at the last minute failed to lend their apartment over the holidays. The hotel where I had booked only one night upon arrival was fully booked and this is where they sent me. Liked it even better! Lovely rooms and great location with two metro stations and shops in the neighborhood. The Thai/Chinese restaurant nearby is great if you need a break after overindulging in the local cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Gilliantomlinson
Reviews.Content: Charming Parisian hotel in a great district. Our room (no. 7) was tiny and faced onto the inner courtyard, but it was spotlessly clean and had everything you needed......it was also very quiet. The breakfast was surprisingly good for Paris - lots of choice including scrambled eggs. Plenty of nice restaurants in the area, so easy to find somewhere to eat after a busy day sightseeing. Vavin metro station is a couple of minutes walk away but we used the buses a lot as you get the sights of Paris for free that way! Buy a 'Paris Visite' card for unlimited Public transport and just pop your ticket in the machine on the bus for validation. All buses have accurate information on board as to which stop you are approaching - makes it very simple. All in all a really good choice for a Paris break.

Reviews.Title: “First Time to Paris”
Reviews.Author: PWDGolfers
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris and we stayed at the Jardin Le Brea Hotel. The hotel is charming. Although the room was small by American standards, it was perfect for our vacation. The staff was extremely personable. And, didn't mind our poor French speaking ability. Our package came with a breakfast, which was delicious. We loved the fresh breads, cheeses, Nutella and jellies.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Clean, Comfortable, Ideal Location, Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: bluizeNewYork
Reviews.Content: I visited Hotel Le Brea on a girls trip to Paris in October to celebrate a milestone birthday. Couldn't ask for a better place to stay. The hotel is quaint and intimate, located on a small street, just a minutes walk from the Vavin metro stop - convenient to all of Paris. This is the perfect neighborhood to return to after a full day of sightseeing and shopping. The rooms are clean and efficient with the expected amenities including a safe. The hotel staff was curteous, friendly, and very accomodating - all spoke English. The breakfast was terrific. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great Paris experience. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to concieve of a hotel more charming.”
Reviews.Author: RealityChuck
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardin La Brea is a real treat. It's a small hotel located on the Left Bank on a quiet side street. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms comfortable (if a bit small -- but that's not a problem). It's about a minute away from the Vavin Metro station and two blocks from Gare Montpernasse and the Jardin de Luxembourg. Everything is very clean and well-maintained. The breakfast spread (included as part of our room) was delicious -- croissants and breads, mostly, with tea, coffee and orange juice. The staff is extremely helpful. They have a computer available for no charge to guests if you need Internet access. Not all the rooms are accessible by elevator, but other than that, it's a great hotel and base for a Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, intimate hotel ideally located in Montparnasse"”
Reviews.Author: Frugalinma
Reviews.Content: Several stays over several years in this charming hotel just off Boulevard Raspail and Boulevard Montparnasse. It's sister hotel is just the other side of the intersection and they are run by a husband-wife team who really know their stuff. Simple but clean and quiet, very economical, good staff, nice breakfast and charming salon in which to meet guests. For family or business travel the location is good, nestled between Montparnasse and St. Germain, a short walk to the Luxembourg Gardens and 2 minutes to the subway stop for the line that goes to Chatelet/Les Halles and 5-10 minute walk to Montparnasse train station. Surrounded by excellent mid-level restaurants, I enjoyed coming here after a day at work and walking the neighborhood. Also only blocks away (toward the Montparnasse tower) of an excellent market.

Reviews.Title: “Super duper parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yausam3
Reviews.Content: Hello All, If you reading this review deciding on whether or not to book this hotel for your stay in Paris then let me offer a little advice (I am well placed to do so as I have just come back from Hotel Jardin Le Brea this very morning). Ok first things first....mmm location: Location:..in close proximity to the ever popular and beautiful Luxembourg gardens and situated in the 6th arrondiesment, you really cant go wrong with the location of this hotel..only a minute walk from the VAVIN metro stop which connects you to the whole of paris in the matter of minutes, the hotel is located in a small yet lively rue de brea street which is filled with small shops (mainly for locals), cafes, restaurants, shops etc etc it is quiet and yet you still get a nice feel of human interaction. If your travelling from the airport, catch the RER B to DENFERT ROCHERAU station then from that station get the METRO line 4 to VAVIN and its a minute walk from the station. 5**** HOTEL ROOM: Yes yes the rooms are small..but lets face it if your not a super large frame then you will have no problems with mobility in your room, apparently this is the norm in paris and if me and my lady stayed in the standard double room which was comfortable had a great view of the rue de brea street and the bed...well lets just say that we had a nice lie in every morning. The rooms are well equipped with your everyday amenities such as towels, hairdryer, toiletries, TV and the best aspect a SAFE to protect all your important documents & passports but disappointly no iron or kettle but thats just me being picky. The rooms are serviced & cleaned everyday..a lil tiny bit worn in some small edges but thats to be expected. 5***** HOTEL: The service of our concierge 'GAELLE' was amazing, she is the loveliest woman you will meet in Paris and she helps out a great deal, speaks amazingly fluent english and is always on hand. Not to miss out but the rest of the staff were top notch too. The hotel is a 3 stars but I never rate hotels on their stars more their reviews and reputation, this is a lovely little hotel that is close to the city but in a non toursity area. In my stay I was included breakfast and if any of you are questioning whether or not to include breakfast in your stay then I highly recommend it..here is a list of what they have to offer for petit dejeuner, scrambed eggs, toast, fresh orange, tea, coffee, pan au chocolat, croissants (2 other buns which were delicious), cereal, baguettes, ham, fruit salad and many more. Ok so thats about it..ooh wait I forgot the best part for 4 nights stay in August over the weekend it cost me and my lady a grand total of 360 euros which is fantastic..around 300 pounds. book with HRS.COM they do the best deals..trust me I did a week of hardcore searching. Enjoy and bon voyage! Samuel p.s: hit the latin quarter for food..try ALEXANDRA and the stone cooked meat, its fun, enjoyable and delicious for only 15 euro per head. get the metro stop to PLACE MONGE for the latin quarter, there is streets of little restaurants inexpensive and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rochl
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel near the Montparnasse train station. Great location near Luxembourg Gardens and walking distance to Metro stop and many good restaurants and shops. Room was very small by American standards, with no-frills appointments. Two twin beds pushed together, so could use as a double or as two twins. Beds were very comfortable and bathroom of adequate size. Free breakfast included, very adequate. Laudromat next door. That alone may be worth our consideration for future trips!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshireTom
Reviews.Content: My teen daughter and I stayed here for a week as a part of a high school graduation present. The room was small but quite adequate for our needs. The room was clean and the daily service good. The stairs are narrow and the whole place is a little eccentric but quite Parisian. The desk staff was always helpful and pleasant. My daughter speaks passable French but at least in the hotel, she did not really need it. The breakfast in the little cavern in the basement is continental plus some extras (scrambled eggs, ham, various cereals) and quite good if you get it included in the daily rate as we did. Rue de Brae is a narrow little street that has a number of OK little food places and small shops. However you are only steps from Blvd. de Montparnasse and that is a very lively place with plenty of restaurants. The Luxembourg Gardens are an easy walk and a great place to simply hang out with the Parisians doing what they do. Latin Quarter is a nice 20 minute walk away. The subway stop is about 100 meters from the front door. We got a Paris Visite Pass and went all over Paris with it quickly and conveniently. I did ask to borrow an iron and board at one point. The desk clerk took me to the hotel laundry room and had me do what I wanted there. I suppose one could get picky about such an arrangement but I was able to iron my clothes. That was fine with me. A good value, I would go certtainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “great value, staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: OCchargersfan
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a few days in july 2009, and came away impressed with the value. The location was perfect- next to metro, Luxembourg gardens (absolutely gorgeous), lots of nice shops/ patisserie / restaurants / ATMs / even one of those Bike exchange-rental locations which was almost perfect: you need a credit card with that gold microchip however to rent one unfortunately- this cost us about 20 min figuring it out. With its location on a small side street adjacent to a larger intersection it was very quiet, but with a nice city feel as well. Rooms were very clean- of course small but what do you expect. Pillows were very small. A very nice breakfast in the am until 10:30. Note- the wifi was not working on the 3rd floor on my laptop- and the house keyboard broke while we were there so essentially no internet access. The staff definitely exceeded expectations- the owner Faisa (?) really saved us and went out of her way our last day. Overall great place to stay and i would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location for Paris first timers”
Reviews.Author: MyMagicalPants
Reviews.Content: Paris was our honeymoon destination, so we wanted to make sure we chose something romantic, clean and convenient. We picked Jardin le Brea from a list of available hotels on an Air France vacation package (6 nights). It was a little bit more money than the default level of hotels, but still inexpensive and absolutely worth it. The hotel is located near the Luxembourg Gardens and the Latin Quarter. There are three different Metro subway stops within a few blocks, so it's easy to get to and from anywhere in Paris. It's not a chain or business-traveler hotel at all. Very cute, quaint, friendly and comfortable. Super friendly staff, free internet access in the lobby, incredible free breakfasts in the downstairs cafe. The room we stayed was on the third floor. There is an elevator, but you can't fit more than two people with no luggage inside. The room was small compared to your typical hotel room, but had every amenity we could need. Everywhere we looked was adorably designed and very comfortable. Full bathroom, flat-screen TV, electronic safe. If you need electrical adapters you can ask at the front desk. Supposedly they have WiFi in the rooms but I couldn't pick it up with my laptop. There's an Irish pub across the street that can be a little loud when the crowd lets out around 2:00am (when your window is open), but that really was the only negative. There are tons of great restaurants, shops and pubs in this area, though things generally shut down much earlier than I expected. In the morning, it's quiet and charming and perfect for a walk or a run through the city. We couldn't have picked a more perfect hotel for out time in Paris, or our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: HLM1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Jardin le Brea from April 16-23, 2009. We booked the hotel through an airfare/hotel package deal with Air France holidays. We had several hotels to choose from in various price ranges, and I chose Jardin le Brea because of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel was perfect for us -- intimate and very "French," but the reception staff spoke perfect English. I started out trying to speak in French but realized there was no point -- their English was infinitely superior to my French. The staff were very helpful with dinner reservations and also booked us a shuttle back to the airport at the end of our trip. The rooms are small (of course) but spotless and very comfortable. Our room seemed to be recently renovated. We were on the second floor and didn't face the street (which I was glad about, since the Irish bar across the street was a bit noisy on weekend evenings), but had a nice view of the little courtyard behind the hotel. Note that there is an elevator but it's VERY tiny -- I wouldn't recommend the hotel if you can't climb stairs. Breakfast was included in the price of our package. It was very simple but the croissants were good. We ate there every day except the last day, when we felt a little tired of the "cave-like" feeling of the breakfast room and decided to eat out. I wouldn't eat there unless breakfast is included with your rate, as there are too many great eating options in Paris to waste your money in a hotel basement! It was fine for us though. There was a computer with free internet access in the lobby, which came in very handy for me. We loved the location of the hotel. There are lots of shops, bakeries, restaurants, etc., very nearby. We bought wine at the wine shop across the street and delicious pastries at the nearby patisserie on Rue Vavin. There is a very interesting African restaurant right around the corner. Also very near to Blvd. Montparnasse, which has literally dozens of restaurants, and one block from the beautiful Jardin de Luxembourg, which we walked through every single day. Altogether a great hotel experience -- perfect home base for getting to know the city on our first trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PEZCollector
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long "Girlfriend Getaway" and chose this hotel on the recommendation of the travel agent with Air France. We were VERY pleased - after arriving early the first morning of our stay (overnight flight) they quickly got our room ready (less than an hour) while we sacked out in the comfy lobby and emailed our hubbies on the community computer. The room was small but well layed out, and the bathroom was ENORMOUS for European standards! They always met our needs for ICE, and the breakfast was very nice. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming, clean, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Riverbirds
Reviews.Content: Jardin le Brea is a very welcoming and comfortable hotel. The whole hotel has been recently renovated and is just very pleasant. It is located close to many metro stops yet on a side-street, so is extremely convenient yet quiet. There are many restaurants and sites close by with a very adequate breakfast provided in the hotel itself. The helpful staff (especially Gail - sp.?) communicates well in English and was able to provide directions and assistance. We loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_freewaydiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of an Air France promotion, and were more than satisfied with the experience. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and the breakfast is tasty. Our room (32) was on the top floor facing the street, but noise wasn't a problem at all (with the help of ear plugs - the pub up the way was a bit...festive...at times). The bathroom was huge, too. The proximity to major attractions is great, and there are three Metro stations nearby that will get you all over the city. Also, the Creperie across the street is quite good. If you're looking for a nice, European boutique hotel, I recommend Jardin le Brea highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kam9s
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a perfect location. The AirFrance shuttle stop is only 4 blocks away along with the train station. Metro stops all around as well. Within walking distance to the Eiffel tower, Musee d'Orsay, the gardens, etc.. My only complaint was that our hot water in the shower lasted all of 3 minutes then turned cold. The walls are thin too but that didn't really bother us. All in all a great choice for your stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JazzRocks
Reviews.Content: I (along with 3 friends) just returned from a week's stay at the Jardin Le Brea hotel in Paris. The rooms are small and the walls are thin, but everything else about this hotel is fantastic. It's an easy walk from the Luxembourg Gardens and close to numerous Metro stations. Just across the small Rue Le Brea from the hotel is a butcher shop, Creperie, wine shop, patisserie and a candy shop. Less than a block away are numerous restaurants & sidewalk cafes. Just a perfect location. The breakfast buffet is very good and served in a charming cave-like room that might have been a wine cellar at one time. The personnel at the front desk are very accomodating and we want to specifically mention Sabrina, who was particularly helpful and added to the pleasure of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: smcgee78
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. The location is amazing, close to the subway, many cafes and great shopping not to mention Luxemborg Gardens. It is easy to access everything you need. There are supermarkets and pastries shops on practically every corner for some cheap eats. The accomodations are small but very clean and the staff are incredibly friendly and ready to help. Our room faced the street and the view was nice and we had no trouble with noise. SInce we stayed in August, there were some smaller shops that were closed for the month, but we still had access to everything we needed. (although I really wanted to check out the one patisserie on the corner that was closed for august:( I definitely recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway. If we ever visit Paris again, we would definitely stay here, no question:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SWFTravelor
Reviews.Content: My 23 year old daughter and I stayed here for four days. Great location-close to tube stop, pastry, wine and food stores, lots of restaurants and shopping. Rooms are small compared to U.S. rooms, but we loved it. Bathroom clean, beds comfy. I sat each evening with the windows open drinking wine, writing in my journal. Front desk personnel very helpful for suggestions. Also, laundrymat right next door. I would definatley recommend and use if I get the chance to go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfectly French”
Reviews.Author: moretolearn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jardin Le Brea for 7 nights and it was just right for us! The location is so convenient to the Metro and to Gare Montparnasse; it's fast and easy to get anywhere. Three of the grand cafes of Paris are just around the corner, so experiencing wonderful French food is just a few euros away. There's also a nice little sandwich shop just up the street, so you'll never go hungry in this neighborhood. The hotel has recently been remodeled: the rooms are tastefully done, the beds and linens are new and so comfortable, and the bathrooms are sparkling clean. The staff is young, energetic, and very helpful. We ate breakfast in the pleasant breakfast room every day because it always started us out on the right foot: as much delicious coffee and steamed milk as you like, cereal, fruit, cheese, ham, and of course--fabulous croissants and bread. We find that we sightsee more happily if we start the day with breakast. We're already dreaming of returning to Paris and we will definitely stay at the Jardin Le Brea!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff; clean, but quant rooms”
Reviews.Author: njrunner
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Paris and found that the hotel was in a great location, the staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean. The rooms were tiny, which is to be expected in Europe. If you are looking for a place to sprawl out-- this is not the hotel, but the location, cleanliness and friendly staff would have me returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: babynae00
Reviews.Content: The Jardin le Brea was a great quaint hotel. The rooms are small but I didn't feel claustrophobic. The front desk staff was extremely nice and helpful. The breakfast in the morning was sufficient. don't expect a huge buffet, but they have good coffee, and pastries. The location is great a few minutes away from the metro that will take you anywhere. I would definitely stay here again. I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Lousy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: locolacanian
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a decent location, around the corner from some restaurants, cinemas and metro in Montparnasse, and an easy walk to St Germain and the Luxembourg Gardens. Situated on a quiet street. The problem I had with the hotel was the room. First it was extremely noisy - I stayed in room 13, the rest of the hotel appeared booked. I heard the elevator, the stairs, conversations in the other rooms on the first floor, it's the loudest hotel I've ever been at, since everything sounded like it was happening in my room In addition, they were doing drilling and hammering outside my window and next door in the morning and throughout the day. I was woken up by drilling the last day, and had to leave, I couldn't sleep through it. I told the concierge, and she seemed to feel I had nothing to complain about. The room itself was on the shabby side, and small, but small is fine. It had a nice hole in the wall above the bathroom, no idea what they ripped out there. The bath also was too small to stretch out in. Otherwise, the concierge was very helpful. It was just a shabby hotel room that had absolutely no insulation from the sound around it. Otherwise, would have been a fine basic place. If you could arrange a quieter room, maybe you want to consider it for the price and the location. However, you've been warned about room 13.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Emerson06
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in quiet local neighborhood. Street and area not busy like boulevards in Monteparnasse. Very close to subway, Lux Gardens, Latin district. Staff was very nice and helpful. Hotel clean and nice. View from hotel was not good. We had internal room facing internal courtyard. Please recommend view of outside street. My friend stayed in the Hotel Denmark (right around the corner)- rooms were a little bigger but view was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: spinmeister
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and it was fairly disappointing. Last time we were fortunate to have a quiet, well sound-proofed room. This time, unfortunately, we found one unfortunate reality: rooms that share a common bathroom wall seem to have virtually no soundproofing. For two nights we were kept up by our next door neighboors, who seemed to be fond of a Parisian late evening. While management did move us to a new room that was better, we will likely not stay here again. Because the hotel is so small, it's a real gamble as to whether you get a good night's sleep. For us, this trumps the hotel's charm and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KLFtravel
Reviews.Content: For three stars this hotel was excellent. Yes the rooms are smaller compared to North American standards but they are perfectly adequate (Trust me that you are not going to be spending much time there). The bathroom was an OK size. You could actually have a soak in the tub. The bed may not look comfortable but looks are deceiving. We have had worse beds in 5 star hotels in N/A. Not much seating in the room but if you wanted to sit and read a book there is a large well appointed sitting area looking out onto the street. As stated in other reviews the air conditioning is really that quite. The windows are very sound proof. The staff is very polite and helpful. The breakfast was good but given the number of restaurants close by not worth the 12e. It was included in our package and we enjoyed it every day. The room was very clean with fresh linen every day. The location is great. There are two metro stops close by and from there you can get just about anywhere. We found that no matter where we were we could either catch a metro or bus that would pretty much get us back to the hotel (excellent metro system and easy to use). The restaurants in the area are excellent and there are plenty to choose from. (I recommend Chez Clement). There is everything from an Irish pub to Thai. The hotel is close to shopping on St. Germain and Luxemburg gardens (probably one of the best in the city). Couple of other things to note for North Americans. The hair dryer in our room had a 115v plug for a shaver (wish I would have known this a head of time). I can’t say of other rooms but one would hope they used the same hair dryer everywhere. The front desk holds the room key while you are out. No need to worry about loosing it. There is someone at the front desk 24/7. Paris itself was amazing. Who says the French are rude? We found that as long as you make attempts to understand the language and culture they are very polite and helpful. We had people come up to us on the street and help us when we were trying to figure out the metro. In one week we ran into one rude person. I would say that average is less than N/A. However avoid Fromers guide to Paris. It was more like a mis-guide. They had places listed in the wrong spot and directions that left you with a lot of walking to get to your destination when there was better and easier ways to get around. Overall a great experience. We will definitely stay at this hotel next we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: joectk
Reviews.Content: Agree with previous comments. Excellent location for this small hotel, on a quiet street not far from Blvd Montparnasse. Easy walk to Metros Vavin and Montparnasse. Recently renovated. Clean hotel with decent size bathrooms. Friendly staff. Suggest booking through hotel website to get best rates, and discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: gooddeals111
Reviews.Content: We booked this package through Air Transat from Toronto for $1450 including taxes per person and found it to be a very good value. The seats on the plane are close, so if upgrading to "Club Class" is an option for you, go for it. LOCATION: This hotel is 5 stars simply for the location. It is in Montparnasse (14th district) and is SURROUNDED by reasonably priced restaurants, pastry shops, and cool cafes where you can sit and have a drink. It is a stone's throw from the Metro Vavin, which will take you to any of the major sites in Paris in 15 minutes or less. Don't bother using taxis, they are slow and expensive. For $1.50 euros you can get anywhere in Paris quickly on the Metro!! ROOM: The room is relatively small, but not as small as others in Paris. Our room overlooked the street, with windows that opened up completely so you could enjoy Rue Le Brea and all of the cool little shops. Rue Le Brea is a quaint side street, so it is away from the other busy main streets of Montparnasse. The windows are sound proof if you choose to close them at night, so no need to stay at the back of the hotel which gives you a view of another building. The bathroom is fine, the only downside was that the tub had a hand held shower which is mounted only a couple feet up the wall, so you would have to hold it to wash your hair and body. The hotel does have other rooms of the "superior" class where there are stand up showers, so you could request these rooms for a slightly higher fee. The AC is the quietest (literally) that I have ever experienced in a hotel. It has a remote and keeps things at an even temperature so you are not always adjusting it. Not like a typical noisy and freezing AC unit in a North American hotel. The tv gets 3 English channels for background noise when you're getting ready--- but who comes to Paris for TV? BREAKFAST The breakfast was very good, a variety of pastries, cereal, fresh fruit salad, baguettes, cheeses and meat, and freshly squeezed juice and coffee. A nice start to the day. Staff is friendly and will help you with any questions. OVERALL I HIGHLY recommend this hotel....clean, tasty breakfast, and the BEST location!! We ate in several districts and found this one to be far superior for food quality and affordability. You are not in a busy tourist area, therefore you are eating where the french dine. We LOVED Paris!!! ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “paris rocks”
Reviews.Author: jmb327
Reviews.Content: After a 5hr delay at filthy JFK airport we were on our way to Paris. We landed 6hrs later at Charles De Gaul airport which was nice and clean. We managed just fine getting our bags and getting a cab to our hotel. The cab ride was much like a cab ride in New York except the driver was very nice and spoke English. We arrived at Jardin Le Brea in about 20 min and the driver didnt even rip us off. The hotel was on a small side street and was beautiful. When we checked in ,the woman behind the counter spoke perfect English and could not be any nicer. she showed us to our room which was spotless clean and very nice. a plazma tv hung on the wall in front of the bed and the room had airconditioning. There was a spiral staircase leading down to the beautiful bathroom. Every thing about the hotel was excellent including the location. We were literally steps away from the Vavin Metro station and just about a block and a half away from the Luxembourg Gardens. Across the street from the hotel was a little cafe with the best "galettes" in town. I forgot the name of the cafe but you will see a little old man standing outside sweeping and saying hello to everyone. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in paris

Reviews.Title: “Charming and French”
Reviews.Author: literature-lover
Reviews.Content: This charming small hotel was beautifully decorated and very clean. The bedroom was small (as expected in Paris), but not excessively so. The bed was comfortable, the curtains were thick, and the room was air conditioned. We never encountered any other American/English guests, so the hotel seemed even more French. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and courteous. Sabrina is an angel. Who said the French are rude? The hotel is quiet and yet very close to the Metro station. We loved our little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DebSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jardin le Brea hotel in Paris for 4 nights in April. We chose this hotel based on recommendations from family. It is in the 6th Androissment, near the Luxemborg Gardens. The location was very convenient. The hotel is on a very cute street (Rue Le Brea) and is a minute walk from the Vavin metro stop (metro #4), and a bustling area with wonderful cafes and shops. The hotel seems tiny. The passages and staircases are narrow, and the elevator can hardly fit a person with a suitcase! We had a room on the first floor with a big window which overlooked Rue Le Brea. It was wonderful to watch the world go by, and it was, surprisingly, not too noisy. The room was small but comfortable. The bathroom did not have a bathtub, only a shower, and was fairly cramped. However, we believe this is fairly standard for Paris. The hotel offered breakfast, but, unlike the hotels we stayed in in Italy, breakfast was not included in the price. We definitely recommend skipping the 12 Euro hotel buffet, and rather pick up coffee and a croissant from one of the many wonderful cafe's surrounding the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly, knowledgeable about Paris and helpful. In fact, before they offered us our room, they warned us that it may be a little noisy as we checked in on a Saturday and there is an Irish Pub on the street near the hotel. However, as stated above, the noise was not a problem. We appreciated their honesty and caution, though. While we would stay here again, I fell in love with an area of Paris around Rue de Buci (near the Odeon and St. Germain des-Pres metro stops) in the heart of the Left Bank a little closer to the Seine River (although also in the 6th Adroissment). If/when we return to Paris, I would research hotels in this area. However, it was an easy walk to this area from Hotel Le Brea, and also very easy to get to via metro.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: OhGreatOne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Le Brea for four nights in January at the end of our European stay and thoroughly loved it. Two friends also stayed in another room and only had good things to say about their room and the hotel as well. The staff suffered through my pigeon French and spoke English competently and without any hint of pretentiousness that we occasionally found elsewhere in the city. Possible negatives that one should be aware of: (1) I guess like pretty much all Parisian hotels, the rooms are somewhat smallish. Having consulted other Parisian hotels on Trip Advisor, we expected a small room. We found the rooms sufficiently large to function in however and by no means were we bumping into each other. (2) Our bath did not have a shower curtain. There was a shower nozzle to wash oneself with, but one had to quickly develop the skill of washing oneself without spraying the floor outside the tub. The tub itself is narrow, so adding a curtain would likely make things just as awkward. It was at the end of our European journey and we had encountered many other worse inconviences than this, but if this was our first stop, I might not have so foregiving about this point. (3) The breakfast was included in our hotel price. Otherwise, my understanding is that the hotel breakfast costs 14 Euro. (It may be slightly cheaper, but the same message applies). This price isn't unusual for Parisian hotels, but there are some nice patisseries up the street that serve most of what's served at breakfast. We loved our morning breakfast downstairs, but unless one absolutely needs Corn Flakes to start their day, I'd recommend coffee and a croissant somewhere else at half the price. (4) Our hotel room faced the street. There is a pub across the street so there was the usual noise of people going to/coming from at closing hours on weekends. One Saturday morning, we could hear the street cleaners or garbage collectors pass by at some entirely too reasonable an hour to be out of bed (8 or 9 a.m.?). Otherwise, the hotel is on a street that is deathly quiet, 50 yards or so from a main intersection where the bustle doesn't seem to stop. For us, the occasional noise was a little thing that we didn't mind given everything else the hotel has to offer. (5) A hairdryer is provided in each room, but my wife informs me that someone with shoulder length hair would spend half a day drying their hair with it, so bring a hairdryer of your own (if you aren't a balding relic like me). Those are my nits to pick. Otherwise, the hotel was beautifully decorated, impeccably clean, fabulously located with an exceptionally helpful and pleasant staff. I realize that my review devotes more space for the negative comments than for the positive, but hopefully if you're aware of small things, the stay will be that much better.

Reviews.Title: “A charming Paris value”
Reviews.Author: capricornvoyager
Reviews.Content: My wife, eighteen year-old daughter and I accepted a recommenation to stay at Hotel La Brea during our recent visit to Paris. My job provides me with lots of opportunity to stay at five star properties around the world, but frankly, we couldn't have asked for a more delightful venue for our stay. The value for money was exceptional and the room and common areas were charming, clean, and more than adequate for our needs. The hotel staff were extremely courteous and helpful in every way possible. Breakfast in the basement "cave" was very good (coffee was delicious and strong) so we started each day with a very satisfying European breakfast that included fruit, cereal, croisants, pastries, scrumptious bread, juice, cold meats and cheese...pretty much more than one needs to fuel up for a solid day of sightseeing.The location couldn't have been nicer with easy access to the Metro system as well as some excellent restaurants on Boulevard du Montparnasse...a few yards up Rue La Brea. We actually took a "shopping stroll" over to Notre Dame, which was surprisingly close after a pleasant walk through the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. Everything we wanted to see and do was an easy trip using the Metro, and we pretty much covered all the highlights of Paris. This is a property we will definitely come back to...and plan to stay longer than the four nights we enjoyed this trip!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Jardin le Brea”
Reviews.Author: DHCWESTON
Reviews.Content: I lived in Paris for a year and have returned a number of times with my family staying at a number of different small boutique hotels on the left bank (which I prefer). This one is around the corner from La Coupole and Montparnasse Ave. on a side street, and a short walk to St. Germain, steps from the Jardin de Luxembourg, convenient to two Metro lines. I think we preferred this Hotel to all the fine others we stayed at over the years. First, we had a wonderful 3 nights for price of 2 deal. But the rooms were nice, with modern touches such as flat screen mounted TV. There is a nice sitting room. Breakfast was good and location is great. No complaints here. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaWarrington
Reviews.Content: As a birthday present for my boyfriend, I booked for us to stay for three nights at Hotel Jardin La Brea two weeks before Christmas 2005. Having read all the reviews about both the hotel and the area of Montparnasse I felt sure that it would be ok, but when we arrived at the metro stop two minutes from Hotel Jardin La Brea (Vavin), I found myself getting nervous - firstly let me clarify that I was not nervous because of the location – I was getting nervous because I had booked the stay at Hotel Jardin La Brea as a birthday present for my boyfriend, and I was terrified that it was going to be awful. I have found Montparnasse to be one of the loveliest areas of Paris; with its ornate buildings, fine selection of restaurants, greengrocers and patisseries and curios shops all dotted along its tree-lined streets. Therefore, I consider Montparnasse not only one of the more attractive areas of Paris, but also one of the more relaxing dining experiences. You can imagine my relief when we arrived at the doors to the hotel to find it completely charming and obviously newly refurbished. We were checked in quickly while our bags were taken up to our room. The hotel is situated down a side road off the main Montparnasse road, meaning that you are very close to everything you might need (restaurants/shops etc), but also far enough away from the busy road that you cannot hear the traffic at night, not even with the window open. I’ll break down my views on the rest of the amenities for ease of reading: Reception and Lounge Areas. The reception and lounge areas were lovely, bright and clean, and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. There was a choice of two lounge areas, one featuring large soft sofas, and the others a more formal cushioned wicker set. Dining Area. The restaurant was located in the cellar, but it was a decent size, beautifully decorated and light, I thoroughly enjoyed my breakfasts down there…and the buffet provided was always well stocked and varied. Rooms. Our room was clean, airy and light. Despite being relatively small, which most hotel rooms in Paris are due to the laws governing period buildings and alterations there-in, it furnished all necessary needs (except for the British requirement of a kettle…but we being British had of course taken an emergency travel kettle! Ha ha ha!). Oh, and there was a decently sized flat-screen TV mounted unobtrusively on the wall for those who cannot go more than a day without feeding the habit, but when turned off you didn’t even notice it was there (for those avoiding reality whilst on holiday, like me!). Bathrooms and Toilets. I found our personal bathroom and toilet (separate) to be clean and modern, and the room was changed every day. I feel I have to mention the shower here (because it is a pet thing of mine), it was a good shower, not one of those terrible ones that dribbles on you and leaves you struggling to get the shampoo out of your hair. The remainder of our stay at Hotel Jardin La Brea continued to be as enjoyable and effortless as our arrival. On the day we were leaving the hotel offered to lock our luggage away while we spent our last day out, before catching the late flight home. I would most certainly return to Hotel Jardin La Brea when I next return to Paris…which I will!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontrealMember
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel on rue Le Brea, just off of the intersection of Boul Montparnasse/Raspail in the upscale Montparnasse district. I stayed here for 4 nights in October 2005 between business meetings in Copenhagen and Orleans and was very pleased by the value, location and service. I was assigned a small but functional room overlooking rue Le Brea. The room was spotlessly clean and simply yet tastefully furnished. The washroom was equally clean and quite large, in contrast to the compact nature of the room. As an avid walker who enjoys exploring the city on foot, I found the hotel conveniently located to access most of the major tourist destinations yet far enough away from the tourist hordes to get a true glimpse of Parisian living. That being said, it is a brisk 25-30 minute stroll to sights such as the Louvre, Effiel Tower and points north of the Seine. For those with less athletic inclination, the hotel is conveniently located within minutes of a couple of metro stations which will take you anywhere in the city. A metro ride to the Champs Elysee for an Sunday evening supper with business colleagues took me less than 10 minutes although the metro appeared remarkably busy even at that hour. There are numerous excellent restaurants, boulangaries and patisseries situated around the intersection of boul Montparnasse/Raspaille and boul Raspaille and rue Vavin. A small but well-supplied grocer can also be found a couple of hundred feet down a quiet side street just south-west of the intersection of Montparnasse and Raspaille which is wonderful for picking up snacks for the hotel room. My positive impressions of the hotel only improved after meeting with my work colleagues at the hotel they were staying at just south of Cimetiere Montparnasse. They payed significantly more (130 Euro/night) for much less of a room in a rather seedy and less convenient location. All in all, I consider the Le Brea to be very good value for money, although missing a few touches to give it an excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “Fine til they gave us the bill”
Reviews.Author: rebsaroo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Brea, Great until there's a problem The hotel le Brea is great till you have a problem. Our problem came with the bill: it was 48 Euros more per night than we had booked, and had confirmed, over the internet. The hike was shock enough. The attitude of the hotel staff was infinitely worse. Though we had the confirmation with us, the receptionist refused to look at it, told us it was impossible that it had ever been agreed, and impossible that we had rung to double check the booking. During an hour of fruitless discussion the receptionist insinuated we were trying to rip the hotel off, and that if we tried to leave she would call the police, despite the fact that we only wanted a cup of coffee (we'd had none that day) and had already offered to pay the agreed price in cash. Refusing us access to anyone in higher authority, eventually the first woman contacted another, who was yet more offensive. Talk about a rotten, rotten end to a 50th birthday celebration. Exhausted we paid the exorbitant price, in the hope that we could sort it all out from home. The moment we contacted Cybevasion the booking agents, they were filled with apology, as were their (maybe parent company?) Paris Exclusive Hotels. After 5 months (yes, 5 months) came good on their promise to compensate us with a free night in another hotel: the Royal St Michel. Oh, and it was great, and the staff were charming, and we fell in love with Paris again. But please, beware the Le Brea, they're mean. Check the price very carefully if you book via the net, and get a confirmation in writing from them before you put your suitcase down in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Quaint, Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuggy2
Reviews.Content: Jardin Le Brea was easy to get to (even though the metro stop nearest to it was closed there are two others in close proximity). When we got there at 9 in the morning we were promptly given our room. the room was small but that is the norm in Paris. The beds were comfy and warm. Bathrooms were clean. Toilet and bathroom are separate and across the room from each other which was weird but just added to the charm. The staff was superb. Especially Chantal who recommended a great restaurant for us for dinner and helped us map out our itineraries for the day. Paris tour bus tickets can be bought at front desk (or in the tour bus itself) which is very convenient. Tour buses can be caught at nearby Raspail metro. Breakfast area was soo beautiful. Breakfast included fruit salad, croissants, ham, coffee, tea, fresh squeezed orange juice, cereal and bread. The area of Montparnasse is quaint and somewhat bohemian. It is not in the midst of the hustle and bustle of Paris and this is what made it a great place to retreat to after full days of touring. It is a great choice of hotel. i know I was very worried about what kind of hotel it would end up being, but I was very pleased at our choice. I was with my friend and her seven year old son, and he kept asking where Chantal was because she was so nice. If you are looking for a peaceful quiet retreat, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: jbberkeleytraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved our time in Paris and were satisfied with our experience at the Jardin Le Brea. The staff were multilingual and very polite. Our room was on the small side, but given the price point, we were ok with that. (We booked an online rate that was better than the hotel's direct rate.) It was great to be so close to the Luxembourg Gardens, and to have so many shops and cute restaurants on our block (Deux Cigales is especially good). The closest metro stop (Vavin) was closed for renovations while we were there, but another stop was close enough that we weren't bothered by this. If we were interested in doing more things in Montparnasse, the location would have been great, but since we found ourselves dining and exploring the St. Germain des Pres/Latin Quarter area so much more, the hotel was just a few blocks south of where we would have preferred to be.The metro makes it quick to reach many things, but being within immediate walking distance to more of the museums, restaurants, and attractions that we were interested in would also have been nice.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Jardin le Brea
HotelInfo.Address: 14 rue Brea | 6th Arr., 75006 Paris, France
